column4: I fell for the temptation to upgrade to Breezy and my sound stopped working. I have no clue what to look, because everything appears OK, I can even get gnome sound-server sounds. I just can't get any audio output from regular programs. Any suggestions for bug-hunting?
start "regular programs" from console, with verbatim output, if possible, and watch what they say about audio
I dont get any error messages from mplayer, xmms, totem, cdplayer etc
check mixer, you may have something muted tjsp
nothing muted either. But I dont wonder why I can suddenly choose between "Intel 82801 (Alsa)" and "Analog Devices (OSS Mixer)"; that's something new I think
check both alsa and oss mixers
I did that also, with no luck. I think I used Alsa under Hoary, so I guess I should stick with Alsa, right?
do you have soundcard _and_ embedded sound too?
I have an IBM tp40, god knows what's inside it
ah, portable, no double sounds then, propably
try different sound outputs with mplayer (choose from setup)
I tried all of those, also without luck - I never had problems with sound before, and the gnome sound is actually working (but I disabled it so it would lock /dev/dsp)
I enabled all 200 switches in the gnome mixer, and it turned out that Head Phone Jack Sense was unchecked, and for some reason muted my output
didn't i say to check the mixer  :D
could it be that you have non-multiplexing sound, so if your laptop thinks input is on, then output is off?
that could be... I dont think this audio driver has multiplexing
